member.name: P:System.Net.Http.OwinHttpMessageHandler.UseCookies
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the handler uses the property to store server cookies and uses these cookies when sending requests.
member.returns: Returns .true if the if the handler supports uses the property to store server cookies and uses these cookies when sending requests; otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:System.Net.Http.OwinHttpMessageHandler.AllowAutoRedirect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the handler should follow redirection responses.
member.returns: Returns .true if the if the handler should follow redirection responses; otherwise false. The default value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the automatic redirect limit. Default is .

member.returns: Returns .The cookie container used to store server cookies by the handler.

member.returns: true to transmit the cookie only over an SSL connection (HTTPS); otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a cookie is accessible by client-side script.

member.name: T:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString
member.summary: Represents the host portion of a Uri can be used to construct Uri's properly formatted and encoded for use in HTTP headers.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new HostString without modification. The value should be Unicode rather than punycode, and may have a port. IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are also allowed, and also may have ports.

member.name: P:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.Value
member.summary: Returns the original value from the constructor.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.ToString
member.summary: Returns the value as normalized by ToUriComponent().

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.ToUriComponent
member.summary: Returns the value properly formatted and encoded for use in a URI in a HTTP header. Any Unicode is converted to punycode. IPv6 addresses will have brackets added if they are missing.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.FromUriComponent(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new HostString from the given uri component. Any punycode will be converted to Unicode.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.FromUriComponent(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new HostString from the host and port of the give Uri instance. Punycode will be converted to Unicode.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.Equals(System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString)
member.summary: Compares the equality of the Value property, ignoring case.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares against the given object only if it is a HostString.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets a hash code for the value.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString.op_Equality(System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString,System.Net.Http.LibOwin.HostString)
member.summary: Compares the two instances for equality.

member.summary: Compares the two instances for inequality.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.PathString.FromUriComponent(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an PathString given the path as it is escaped in the URI format. The string MUST NOT contain any value that is not a path.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.QueryString.ToString
member.summary: Provides the query string escaped in a way which is correct for combining into the URI representation. A leading '?' character will be prepended unless the Value is null or empty. Characters which are potentally dangerous are escaped.

member.name: M:System.Net.Http.LibOwin.QueryString.ToUriComponent
member.summary: Provides the query string escaped in a way which is correct for combining into the URI representation. A leading '?' character will be prepended unless the Value is null or empty. Characters which are potentially dangerous are escaped.
